alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 4:24PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR PRESCOTT YAVAPAI COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MST... At 421 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over portions of south Prescott, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, wind gusts up to 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...40 mph winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects and Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall may result in street flooding, especially in the more urbanized areas of Prescott and Prescott Valley. Locations impacted include... Prescott Valley, Prescott, Glassford Hill, Quartz Mountain, Thumbe Butte, Antelope Park, Rancho Vista Estates, Prescott Airport, Willow Creek Reservoir, Sunset Lookout, Granite Creek Park, Prescott Gateway Mall, Indian Hill West Prescott, Wildwood Estates, Yavapai Campground, Fain Lake, Alto Pit OHV, and Lynx Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 298 and 322. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 328. State Route 69 between mile markers 285 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
